dc:title: From Union Square to Rome Dorothy Day 1938, Chapter 5, pp. 51-60. An account of the deep friendship with Rayna Prohme whose joyousness and love for truth deeply impressed her. Although Rayna died a Communist, she is counted among those who belong "to the invisible unity of the Church." DDLW #205 1938-01-07 James Allaire Creative Commons Non-Commercial Share Alike 3.0 en-US http://www.catholicworker.org/dorothyday/daytext.cfm?TextID=205
